channel.title: If Only You Set Me Free on
channel.description: Recent content in If Only You Set Me Free on

item.title: Alucinara Energy
item.description: Overview Alucinara, also known as magic, is a form of energy that alters the ways in which the natural world can operate.

item.title: Bushdeer
item.description: Overview Bushdeer (Type Species spp. Floricervus Floricervus), native to the steppes of the 2nd and -1st realms, are a type of deer related to the Sika deer of Earth.

item.title: Cloud Gnats
item.description: Overview Cloud Gnats are animal-like apparitions made of alucinariferous dust. They commonly appear as small animals, standing upright with their abdomen tapering off into a wispy tail.

item.title: Demi-Slugs
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: Early History of the Minikin
item.description: Timeline 5 MYA Minikin begin to diverge from the lineage that would become red squirrels Minikin ancestors are shifted from the 0th realm to the 2nd due to supernova 3 MYA The genus Anthrosciurus diverges from Sciurus Anthrosciurids begin to use tools 1 MYA Anthrosciurids begin to use fire and magic Language is developed in Anthrosciurids 300,000 YA Early Minikin evolve into Modern Minikin (Anthrosciurus arborensis) in northern Tséireph 200,00 YA First wave of minikin migration takes place Ancestors of Eastern Minikin (subspecies Anthrosciurus arborensis occidentalis) migrate to the eastern continent and eastern islands Modern Minikin spread across whole of Tséireph 175,000 YA Second wave of minikin migration takes place Ancestors of Southern Minikin (subspecies Anthrosciurus arborensis australis) migrate to southwestern continent 50,000 YA Third and final wave of minikin migration takes place Ancestors of Insular Minikin (subspecies Anthrosciurus arborensis insulensis) diverge from Southern Minikin and continue to migrate south to the southwestern archipelago The various Minikin subspecies begin to spread and cohabitate with other races 10,000 YA Agriculture begins to be practised by Minikin, originating in fluvial areas with seasonal floods, especially the mediterranean-climate Sarvaran river basin.

item.title: Every Force of Nature
item.description: So, every force of nature showed the shattered ways the crystal glowed. A gemstone fit to lose our minds, that let us know such things remote; the broken ways the aura binds

item.title: Fauna of the Second Realm
item.description: Minikin Minikin are a sapient rodent species native to the 2nd realm. They are descended from the European Red Squirrel, with a lifespan of 12-18 years, reaching maturity around 8 years of age.

item.title: Flora of the Second Realm
item.description: Nyuta Bushes Nyuta bushes are a type of bush native to the 2nd and 1st realms. They have red leaves and purple berries.

item.title: History of the Morellic Minikin
item.description: Overview The Morellic race is a race of minikin descending from the Sarvaran, Aqhoran, and Corothic cultures. These cultures were forager nomads from the west, north, and east, who settled in the Sarvaran river basin due to it’s highly fertile soil and the Mora river’s seasonal flooding.

item.title: Minikin
item.description: Overview Minikin (spp. Anthrosciurus sapiens) are a small rodent species native to the 2nd Realm. They are arboreal omnivores which tend toward eating nuts and other plants, and descended from red squirrels from the 0th realm.

item.title: Morellic Clothing
item.description: Overview Morellic clothing is characterised by three things: Shape, Colour, and Material. These three elements come together to create a morellic garment.

item.title: Phantasmarrhoea
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvara was a Morellic city state, civilisation, and culture. It held a great amount of influence during the minikin Bronze age, and served as the foundation for it’s successor state, the Empire of the Petrified Child.

item.title: Soulstones
item.description: Overview Soulstones are deposits of bitumen or asphalt where, in the presence of alucinara energy, the soul of a deceased organism may be stored after death.

item.title: The 2nd Realm
item.description: Overview The 2nd realm is the 2nd ultra-essent realm, and is contra-essent to the -2nd realm. The 2nd realm’s main planet is Qherelh, inhabited by the native minikin.

item.title: The Angels
item.description: Overview The angels are celestial beings created by the Judges to govern the elements of the cosmos. They are worshipped as parts of the pantheons of many Minikin cultures, and can be communicated with through dreams, visions, and prayer.

item.title: The Early Morellic Peoples
item.description: Overview The early Morellic peoples were nomadic, tribal groups living in the south of Tseireph during the minikin Neolithic era, or late stone age.

item.title: The Language of Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvaran was a Morellic language spoken in the Sarvaran civilisation during the Minikin bronze-age. It was polysynthetic, head-final, and head-marking, with an SOV word order.

item.title: The Mind Controls
item.description: A rodent sat atop the cliff of an inlet, its whole life built upon service to an instinct. Staring down at the rocks upon which a wave rolls, here the world now makes sense, to the heart, so thoughts sink’d;

item.title: The North Wind and the Sun
item.description: Original Text The North Wind and the Sun were disputing which was the stronger, when a traveler came along wrapped in a warm cloak.

item.title: The Petrified Child
item.description: Overview The Petrified Child is a semi-corporeal deity which is worshipped by many minikin groups, including the Morellic minikin. The child’s duty is to destroy all evil according to its own moral code, protecting the cosmos1 from any living being who wishes to desecrate it.

item.title: The Sarvaran Epic Narrative
item.description: SCRIPTURA EX MUNDO PRAE ET POST FRACTO Chapter 1 The Cosmos Given Shape Before Lunuth had first sprouted, before it had been ground into flour or baked into bread, the first Judge and the second Judge ruled the cosmos, to give it order.

item.title: The Spirits of Darkness
item.description: Overview The spirits of darkness are celestial beings that were created by the second Judge behind the first’s back out of jealousy for the first’s superiority.

item.title: title
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: title
item.description: Overview The Judges are the two celestial beings from the beginning of the cosmos who created the universe, the spirits of darkness, and the angels.

item.title: Watchstones
item.description: Overview Watchstones are stones1 with eyes through which the Petrified Child sees, giving the deity a greater visual field and protecting those nearby from evil.
